info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 06 at 1:23AM CDT until April 06 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 AM CDT FOR WESTERN STONE...SEARCY...NORTHEASTERN VAN BUREN AND SOUTH CENTRAL BAXTER COUNTIES... At 123 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Marsena, or 7 miles west of Marshall, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fairfield Bay... Marshall... Shirley... Thola... Marsena... Kay... Rocky Hill... Duff... Point Peter... Maumee... Elba... Bohannon... Imo... Old Lexington... Elberta... Watts... Blanchard Springs Campground... Leslie... St. Joe... Big Flat... TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
